file_content.text: Bothawui needs help. The Protectors are here to deliver.
You've got good timing, Captain. I've just finished securing the Bosnar Dam.
You and your men chose to fight. These civilians came to us for protection, and I won't force them into harm's way.
I want anyone who can hold a blaster front and center. Have the rest run supplies.
Everyone fights, no exception.
Not only are the civilians staying put, but some of these men are going to guard them.
We keep the civilians safe.
You heard the Jedi. Move!
Hold the line! Protect the civilians!
The Jedi's mine! Kill the rest!
Aim for the Imperials! Stay out of the Jedi's way!
Did we get the only sociopath in the order? More death is not the answer!
Get moving. Sounds like that scout doesn't have much time.
Don't worry about us. You just get to that dam.
If we live through this, I'll be the first to shake your hand.
We've got Imperials marching on us from all directions. Not Blight's men. Scouts are reporting a Sith Lord at rear guard.
Were you able to get past the dam? Just send me coordinates, and I'll move out.
I'll be right there.
Did the scouts get a good look at this Sith Lord? Can they confirm his identity?
You think it's Legius?
If this is a direct attack from the Imperial military, our troops have to respond.
Can we get backup?
We're camped at a village in the flooded plains, on the way to Camp Sovereign. Been taking in refugees, thought we'd be safe out here....
Down, behind the supplies! Garith, get your men out here--
Protectors = in trouble // Jedi + T7 = must hurry!
Sounds like the Empire showed up early. They're always doing that.
I'm not going to get a lot of downtime while we're here, am I?
Estimated travel time to Ferla is fifteen minutes. Ready when you are.
The Sith Lord's heralds have arrived. We should not delay.
No. But I sure hope there aren't two Sith Lords gunning for us.
Just started their final push into Imp territory. If they couldn't spare anyone before, they definitely can't now.
Reassurance: Many have tried to delete the Protectors, master, but none have succeeded. Yet.
How rude! Holocall etiquette should really be part of basic training.
She sure knew how to make an entrance. What a mess.
The civilians fought bravely, for not having a choice about it. Make sure these bodies are gone before the rest come back.
I'll take a pile of rubble over the alternative. Those civilians wouldn't have lasted ten seconds against a Sith Lord.
From what the Sith said, you've done this countless times. Against your own Masters, even... it must have been difficult.
I made a promise to serve the Republic, the same as you. We face what we have to.
It's a Jedi's duty.
Served three tours before the treaty. Never thought to thank a Jedi until now.
A Jedi's life should be dedicated to peace. Mine's been nothing but war.
Sometimes, it gets tiring.
Maybe one of us will live to see the end. At my age, I'd bet it's you.
They betrayed me to serve the Emperor. I'm only sorry they went so quickly.
They got what they deserved.
In my day, Jedi were pacifists. Guess war does change everything.
Heard from our boys at the Bosnar Dam. They say there's a new river where an Imperial outpost used to be. Nice work.
Heard from our boys at the Bosnar Dam. That water carved out a whole new river. Too bad we flooded out the Imps.
Our injured here will make it. No damage to our supplies or your shuttles. We want to hit Camp Sovereign, now's our chance.
You're the best battering ram we've got. If you carve out room for us to land, we'll have that work camp evacuated in minutes.
We just killed a Sith Lord's apprentice. He may try to strike back.
Watch out for Legius.
We'll keep both eyes open. But you've got to keep yours forward.
Do we know anything about Camp Sovereign's defenses?
What can we expect?
I could use a squad of angry resistance fighters at my back.
Garith should help me.
So could we, while you're gone. They'll be coming in with us.
Garith sent some scouts to see what you're up against. They were supposed to rendezvous with Doctor Kantos--ah, must be her now....
Sir. The scouts are back--one of them, anyway. Says the rest died in the field.
The one who lived... he's badly injured. Doctor Kantos thinks we might lose him, too.
Give me your location, and I'll get there as soon as I can. Try to keep him comfortable.
I'd better hurry.
Comfortable? We passed "comfortable" six blood transfusions ago.
I won't interrogate a dying man. Whatever's waiting in Camp Sovereign, I'll face it alone.
Let him rest, then.
Oh, no. This man risked his life to bring you information, and you're going to hear it.
They'll pay for this, Garith. I'll take ten of Blight's men for every Bothan we've lost.
Blasted Imperials.
Send them the coordinates. Then quit fiddling with the comm and help me keep this man alive!
Don't wait up for us. When you've got what you need, hit Camp Sovereign. We'll be ready when you call.
Report, Captain.
All civilians accounted for, but resistance scouts report one more squad on the way. It's not over yet.
Will be when they get here. Half my men are dead or dying. The civs can't stand on the sideline anymore--we need them armed.
Civilians = not combat trained // Jedi + T7 = combat veterans!
First you'd let a village get bombed. Now you want to give guns to small children?
So they can die, too? I think you're missing the point, here.
Give me thirty seconds to teach aiming and ten for reloading. They'll be ready.
We fight for our own survival. Why shouldn't they?
Perplexity: My master and I are already armed. What more is required?
Sir, it seems highly unlikely the civilians have permits for heavy weaponry....
Great. They'll get front-row seats to this massacre.
More Imperials are on the way. We need volunteers to fight with Garith's men.
Let the people choose.
The more people step forward, the more of us survive.
So this is your champion. The one you trust with your lives, and those of every trembling parasite you rescue.
The Jedi who murdered Tarnis, Sadic, Nefarid and Angral. Who attacked his own Masters for siding with the enemy.
They were threats to the Republic. They had to be stopped.
I had no choice.
And you call us barbaric.
You seem to know a lot about me, Sith. I can't say the same of you.
Who are you?
I also killed the Emperor. But I'm sure no one's mentioned that.
And that's not all....
Mention it again, and I'll cut out your tongue.
My master swore the Republic would burn for lying about the Emperor's fate. You opposed him on Talravin. Did you think he forgot?
If the Emperor's alive, where is he? Why hasn't he spoken? It's the Dark Council who's lying.
The Emperor truly is dead.
Darth Angral swore the Republic would burn. I defeated him, and I'll defeat Legius, too.
Your master won't win.
Everyone's in position, but you've got to get these Seekers online!
It was the civilians' choice to fight. No soldier could have done better. Make sure their families know that.
I am Lord Votari. Apprentice to Darth Legius, the Hammer of Chommell and Praetor to the Army of the Dark Council.
Silence!
If my master falls, he'll take all of you with him.
Do you know how many Sith Lords threaten the Republic every day? I lost count back on Coruscant.
I forgot him pretty fast.
My master is no ordinary Sith. He stands for the Empire--and I stand for him.
The Jedi who murdered Tarnis, Sadic, Nefarid and Angral. Who attacked her own Masters for siding with the enemy.
Get as many civs inside as you can. The rest, take cover!
